meanings.definition: A piece or segment of something
meanings.sent1: She handed me a small part of the puzzle to solve.
meanings.sent2: The broken vase was missing a part.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel stored each part of the nut in different places.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like a missing part of a jigsaw puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The key part of the plan was to remain hidden.

meanings.definition: To divide or separate into pieces
meanings.sent1: Please part the hair in the middle for the hairstyle.
meanings.sent2: The magician used a wand to part the sea of audience members.
meanings.sent3: I had to part the curtains to let the sunlight in.
meanings.sent4: The clouds seemed to part as the sun emerged.
meanings.sent5: She used a knife to part the cake into equal slices.

meanings.definition: To participate or take a role in something
meanings.sent1: I will part in the school play as a tree.
meanings.sent2: He decided to part in the charity event to help others.
meanings.sent3: She didn't want to part in the argument between her friends.
meanings.sent4: The students were eager to part in the science experiment.
meanings.sent5: He was excited to part in the dance competition next week.
